channel.title: Bought a new car
channel.description:
I finnaly decided that I could part with a car... The Honda Integra DC2 is gone now.
However something faster and something that can match with my Skyline has returned for it.
It's a Toyota Supra from 1996. I'm importing it from Japan. It will be in the Netherlands next month.
Some pics: [img]http://img228.imageshack.us/img228/7933/58765938.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img41.imageshack.us/img41/3877/93811084.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img30.imageshack.us/img30/6308/15749760.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img151.imageshack.us/img151/8258/48707869.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img150.imageshack.us/img150/1578/56707705.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img189.imageshack.us/img189/1503/27397478.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img37.imageshack.us/img37/4354/70792825.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img22.imageshack.us/img22/9612/p1060145.jpg[/img]
I'm interested how it'll compare to my Skyline with a 2.6 liter 6 cilinder twin turbo. This is a 3.0 liter 6 cilinder twin turbo.

item.title: Bought a new car
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“Waffendennis, post:26, topic:293494”]The car costs more than shipping ;)!
I paid around €1.400 for insured shipping in a standard sea container.
The car costs way more than that.[/quote]

I was just poking fun. Not saying anything about the price of the car. Just the insane cost for shipping things out of Asia.

Read full topic

item.description:

Elijah:

I imagine having the car shipped to you, cost more than the car itself.

I don’t know the prices of shipping a car, but a standard container from the Netherlands to Asia costs about €4000.

There’s an amazing store we just found out about in Ottawa that sells suped up japanese imports. I was really tempted to buy a skyliner from there

shoulda done, what sort of prices were they?

item.title: Bought a new car
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Nice car…

Oh and mopar.

The Traffic police in my area use many cars along with Volvo T5, and the one i asked about the engine… the Vauxaul Vectra

Their vectras have in em and i quote (from a copper i asked)

“well it says on the back its got a 3l but its actually a 3.8l V6”

That engine is enough to get em easily to 155mph… more then enough for most cars in the UK.

Read full topic

item.title: Bought a new car
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

In NZ, all normal cars (Ford, Holden, Toyota, Nissan, Honda, Mitsubishi, etc) have the indicator control on the right of the steering wheel, but the fancy Euro cars like Jag and shit have it on the left. John Deere tractors also have it on the left.
Also, the gears here are just
135
24 R

or in the nice cars

135
246 R

and some holdens

R 135
24

Read full topic

1 3 5
2 4 R
kuz thats how ours is laid out. Write back soon.
Love davidude[/quote]
i believe so, though ive never driven a manual
our signals are on the left too

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

la­wl:

i couldnt figure out why the radio was on the left side of the steering wheel… then i remembered that europe fags drive on the opposite site

We drive on the right side of the road. The car is from Japan, and they drive on the left side of the road.

Read full topic

item.title: Bought a new car
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

Thanks everyone.

I only want cars for performance, however the Supra offers best of both worlds.
0-60 4,1 seconds. Top speed 200mph (after you defeat the speed limiter of 250 km/h).

Engine size is big enough for me, I mean it’s pushing out a fair enough of WHP to ‘smoke’ almost any car I see on the road (even talking about some Porsches, Lamborghini’s and Ferrari’s).

Fat Cookies is right. Compared to a American muscle car the Supra is relatively light.
It weights about 1.500KG (3.307 pounds). Out of the factory the car pushes 330 WHP.
The previous owner(s) already did some performance upgrades such as:

-Cold air intake filter
-Free flow and bigger diameter exhaust
-Blitz BOV (blow off valve) with uprated spring
-Removed the two catalytic converters (part of the free flow exhausts)

Supra’s are well known that their power can be uprated very easy (but not cheap hahaha).
According to fellow Supra owners those performance upgrades are bringing the car to near 360/370WHP.

I already have some extra upgrades laying around for the car which are:

  • Upgraded FMIC (front mount intercooler) to replace the OEM intercooler
  • Upgraded intercooler piping to replace the OEM piping
  • Upgraded couplers for the piping
  • Speed limit defeater
  • Boost controller
  • Boost, oil and temp meters to monitor what the car is doing (it won’t be a good thing if I have boost creap or the engine runs to hot for example hahaha)

When that’s installed I will bring the boost a couple of PSI up, let the ECU be remapped to fit the upgrades. Then I hope I will be around 450WHP.
That will be enough for now. The Getrag 6 speed gearbox can hold upto 600BHP. However sources claim that they’re running their Supra’s on 800+ BHP with the Getrag gearbox without any failures so far.

As for the steering wheel, for me it’s on the ‘wrong’ side.
We have the steering wheel on the left side, and drive on the right side.
But I’m used to driving on the ‘wrong’ side (Skyline and the Integra both RHD).

Read full topic

item.title: Bought a new car
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Engine is too small.

for america.
In Europe a 3 litre car is very respectable and you wont look like a tree hugger. Since the Supra is relativly light compared to american muscle it will be very quick.

Im confused, Japan and England drive on the correct side (left) and pretty much the rest of Europe drive on the right… Where does the Netherlands fit in?

Read full topic
